intro: Linaria spartea var. praecox, commonly known as early flaxflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and delicate, spurred flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers, which range in color from yellow to orange, bloom early in the spring. It is often found in open woodlands and grasslands, where it contributes to the floral diversity of the ecosystem.
